column4: hi. does anybody know how to run a python script in the background?
if your program spits out text it'll still spill into the console.
so can i redirect output to /dev/null?
you can also background any running process by hitting ctrl-Z and then typing `bg`
then you can type `jobs` to see a list of jobs, and `fg #` to foreground a certian job
but remember, these will all die when you exit the shell.
might want to look into `screen` or `nohup`
ok, so i tried that more less, but like you said...it's all gone when you exit the terminal
how can i get it to live on?
nohup will leave it running but you can't interact with it.
running it in a screen console will allow you to regain control of it later.
right, but i don't need that...i can always send a kill signal....lemme try that out quick
